content: this legal text discusses a case involving the division of property between two parties the appellant is appealing a partial judgment that ordered an expert investigation to determine the value and divisibility of the property the appellant argues that they have exclusive ownership of the property because they used their own inherited money to purchase it the court examines the requirements for excluding community property and determines that the declaration by the nonacquiring spouse is not necessary in this case the court also considers the constitutionality of this requirement ultimately the appeal is accepted and the court declares that the appellant has exclusive ownership of the property the appellees counterclaim for division is rejected and the court orders the appellant to be reimbursed for their costs
